wikipedia_page.main: James Haughton (5 May 1795 – 20 February 1873), nicknamed "Vegetable" Haughton, was an Irish social reformer, temperance activist and vegetarian.

response: An offer by United Irish veteran, Valentine Lawless (Lord Cloncurry) to chair a committee to adjust the dispute between Old and Young Ireland had been rejected by John O'Connell in reportedly "very saucy and unbecoming language". An offer of mediation from the abolitionist and pacifist James Haughton was also spurned.Roger Courtney (2013), Dissenting Voices: Rediscovering the Irish Progressive Presbyterian Tradition, Ulster Historical Foundation, Belfast, p. 156

Sir James Haughton, CBE, QPM (26 February 1914 – 26 January 2000)Lives in Brief. The Times (London, England), Monday, March 27, 2000; pg. 21; Issue 66,785 was Chief Inspector of Constabulary from January 1976 to July 1977.HMIC Profile

Benjamin Haughton (1855–1932) was an Irish businessman from Cork city, who was an independent member of Seanad Éireann from 1922 to 1928.  He was from the Cork branch of a Quaker family whose Carlow branch included social reformer James Haughton and scientist Samuel Haughton. Benjamin was head of Haughton's timber and iron merchants in Cork and a supporter of the local YMCA.
* James Haughton (police officer) (1914–2000), British police officer
* James Haughton (reformer) (1795–1873), Irish social reformer, temperance activist and vegetarian
* James Haughton (activist) (1929–2016), American civil rights activist, labor leader, community organizer, and social worker
